Barrett's esophagus is a condition where the normal stratified squamous epithelium of the lower esophagus is replaced by columnar epithelium due to chronic acid reflux. Barrett's esophagus carries an increased risk of developing esophageal adenocarcinoma. Therefore, long-term continuation of medication to control GERD is recommended. Squamous cell carcinoma (SCC), gastro-intestinal stromal tumor (GIST), and MALT lymphoma are not commonly associated with Barrett's esophagus.
